Global Hangout: Ask the Experts: Myth Busters (8/3/2020)

Dr. Arora joins Professor of Microbiology Emanuel Goldman and Epidemiologist Tara Smith in an interview with NBC News to address some common questions arising amid the progressing pandemic.

“GLOBAL HANGOUT: Can coronavirus live on surfaces? Should we wash groceries before using them? Can the virus be beaten with sunshine and healthy eating? How will scientists ensure a vaccine is safe? Global Hangout puts your most popular questions to expert myth busters.”

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ admin_label=”Media Row” _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”default” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|50|50|100|4|0|0″][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.5.1″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Mercy Hospital” _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”default” height=”400px” overflow-y=”scroll” custom_padding=”30px|30px|30px|30px|true|true” animation_style=”flip” animation_direction=”right” animation_speed_curve=”ease” link_option_url=”https://www.wbez.org/stories/chicagos-mercy-hospital-to-close-in-2021/dc41bed2-a1ae-4095-8975-fe657853b119″ link_option_url_new_window=”on” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|50|50|100|4|0|0″ box_shadow_style=”preset1″]

Mercy Hospital, A Historic Near South Side Medical Center, Plans To Close After Merger Plan Fails

The struggling hospital was one of four that had hoped to merge, but failed in its attempt to get money from the state to do so.

Read Here (7/29/20)

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.5.1″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Disrupted Sleep” _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”default” height=”400px” overflow-y=”scroll” custom_padding=”30px|30px|30px|30px|true|true” animation_style=”flip” animation_direction=”right” animation_delay=”250ms” animation_speed_curve=”ease” link_option_url=”https://www.usnews.com/news/health-news/articles/2019-01-18/disrupted-sleep-plagues-hospital-patients-but-new-program-might-help” link_option_url_new_window=”on” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|50|50|100|4|0|0″ box_shadow_style=”preset1″]

Disrupted Sleep Plagues Hospital Patients, But New Program Might Help

Over a year, patients in the so-called SIESTA unit also experienced an average of four times fewer disruptions for medication dosing and three times fewer for routine vital signs.

Read Here (1/18/19)

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.5.1″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text admin_label=”UChicago EHR tool” _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”default” height=”400px” overflow-y=”scroll” custom_padding=”30px|30px|30px|30px|true|true” animation_style=”flip” animation_direction=”right” animation_delay=”500ms” animation_speed_curve=”ease” link_option_url=”https://www.beckershospitalreview.com/patient-experience/uchicago-medicine-cuts-inpatient-sleep-disruptions-with-ehr-tool.html” link_option_url_new_window=”on” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|50|50|100|4|0|0″ box_shadow_style=”preset1″]

UChicago Medicine cuts inpatient sleep disruptions with EHR tool

University of Chicago Medicine successfully reduced nighttime disruptions for patients by integrating a sleep-friendly tool into its EHR. Researchers described the initiative and its outcomes in a study published in the Journal of Hospital Medicine.

Read Here (1/9/19)

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row column_structure=”1_3,1_3,1_3″ admin_label=”Media Row” _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”default” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|50|50|100|4|0|0″][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.5.1″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Closing Pay Gap” _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”default” height=”400px” overflow-y=”scroll” custom_padding=”30px|30px|30px|30px|true|true” animation_style=”flip” animation_direction=”right” animation_speed_curve=”ease” link_option_url=”https://www.the-hospitalist.org/hospitalist/article/163416/closing-gender-gap” link_option_url_new_window=”on” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|50|50|100|4|0|0″ box_shadow_style=”preset1″]

Closing the gender gap: Hospitalists address inequity in medicine

“As I approach mid-career, I see these issues affecting my career and my colleagues’ careers and I decided we need to be doing more work in this space,” said Dr. Arora.

Read Here (4/13/2018)

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.5.1″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Sleep Disturbances” _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”default” height=”400px” overflow-y=”scroll” custom_padding=”30px|30px|30px|30px|true|true” animation_style=”flip” animation_direction=”right” animation_delay=”250ms” animation_speed_curve=”ease” link_option_url=”https://www.medscape.com/viewarticle/879747″ link_option_url_new_window=”on” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|50|50|100|4|0|0″ box_shadow_style=”preset1″]

Sleep Disturbances Drift Off With Order Changes, Reminders

Education and “nudges” for providers can cut hospital sleep disruptions and boost patient-satisfaction scores, a new study suggests.

Read Here (5/9/17)

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type=”1_3″ _builder_version=”4.5.1″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text admin_label=”Gender Bias” _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”default” height=”400px” overflow-y=”scroll” custom_padding=”30px|30px|30px|30px|true|true” animation_style=”flip” animation_direction=”right” animation_delay=”500ms” animation_speed_curve=”ease” link_option_url=”https://www.forbes.com/sites/brucelee/2017/03/12/three-new-studies-suggest-gender-and-racial-bias-in-medical-training/#58fcdd961930″ link_option_url_new_window=”on” scroll_horizontal_motion=”0|50|50|100|4|0|0″ box_shadow_style=”preset1″]

Three New Studies Suggest Gender And Racial Bias In Medical Training

The results suggested significant racial bias in AOA selection, which is supposed to be merit-based…sort of like the Oscars, right?

Read Here (3/12/17)

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][et_pb_row _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_column type=”4_4″ _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”default”][et_pb_text _builder_version=”4.6.0″ _module_preset=”default”]
